MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator DropColumns (this Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog catalog, params string[] columnNames);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator DropColumns(class Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog catalog, string[] columnNames) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function DropColumns (catalog As TransformsCatalog, ParamArray columnNames As String()) As ColumnSelectingEstimator
static member DropColumns : Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog * string[] -> Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator

Docs.param: The array of column names to drop.
Docs.summary: DropColumns is used to select a list of columns that user wants to drop from a given input. Any column not specified will be maintained in the output schema.
Docs.remarks: is commonly used to remove unwanted columns from the schema if the dataset is going to be serialized or written out to a file. It is not actually necessary to drop unused columns before training or performing transforms, as 's lazy evaluation won't actually materialize those columns. In the case of serialization, every column in the schema will be written out. If you have columns that you don't want to save, you can use to remove them from the schema.

Docs.param: The array of column names to keep.
Docs.summary: Select a list of columns to keep in a given .

remarks.format: <xref:Microsoft.ML.SelectColumns(Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog, string[])> operates on the schema of an input <xref:Microsoft.ML.IDataView>, dropping unselected columns from the schema.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator SelectColumns (this Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog catalog, string[] columnNames, bool keepHidden);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator SelectColumns(class Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog catalog, string[] columnNames, bool keepHidden) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function SelectColumns (catalog As TransformsCatalog, columnNames As String(), keepHidden As Boolean) As ColumnSelectingEstimator
static member SelectColumns : Microsoft.ML.TransformsCatalog * string[] * bool -> Microsoft.ML.Transforms.ColumnSelectingEstimator

Docs.param: The array of column names to keep.
If will keep hidden columns and will remove hidden columns.
Docs.summary: Select a list of columns to keep in a given .

remarks.format: operates on the schema of an input , either dropping unselected columns from the schema or keeping them but marking them as hidden in the schema. Keeping columns hidden is recommended when it is necessary to understand how the inputs of a pipeline map to outputs of the pipeline. This feature is useful, for example, in debugging a pipeline of transforms by allowing you to print out results from the middle of the pipeline. For more information on hidden columns, please refer to [IDataView Design Principles](~/../docs/samples/docs/code/IDataViewDesignPrinciples.md).
